passages.text: EQUITY: CAPITAL GOODS
Solid 1H25 backed by refrigeration; liquid cooling likely to support long- term EPS growth; upgrade to Buy

Sanhua reported 1H25 results on 28 Aug after market close and hosted an investor and analyst meeting on 29 Aug. 1H25 revenue increased \(19\%\) y- y to CNY16,263mn, which was mainly supported by \(+25\%\) y- y sales growth in refrigeration supported by subsidy program in China and growing penetration in the overseas market, offset by a slower \(9\%\) y- y growth in the auto component business due to key client's lackluster shipment. 1H25 earnings increased \(39\%\) y- y to CNY2,110mn, which was driven by a 0.7bps y- y improvement in gross margin at \(28.1\%\) , and a decline in opex ratio to \(12.4\%\) (vs \(13.9\%\) in 1H24), supported by management's operating efficiency initiatives.

2H25F outlook appears mixed: 1) with moderate growth in the auto components segment likely tempered by key client's lackluster shipment volumes; 2) while the air conditioning business will likely face near- term headwinds - as per China Industry Online, domestic home AC production output is projected to fall \(6.3\% /23.4\% /17.6\%\) y- y in Sep/Oct/Nov- 25, with exports down \(16.6\% /7.8\% /9.1\%\) ; although the company's role as a key supplier to Xiaomi (1810 HK, Neutral), which continues to gain market share, will likely provide some offset, broader market weakness could exert a short- term drag. Moreover, 3) Sanhua's strategic pivot into liquid cooling solutions, including self- developed products such as pumps, valves, and heat exchangers, bodes well for diversification, having already generated over CNY10bn revenue in 2024 and positioning the firm as a core components supplier in this high- growth segment, which is poised to emerge as a new driver of upside. Further, 4) the humanoid robot business is likely to be on track for mass production in 2026F, complemented by its sustained leading market share in key client.

We upgrade Sanhua to Buy from Neutral and raise TP to CNY37 to reflect our positive read on liquid cooling potential. We raise 2025/26F EPS forecasts to CNY1.09/1.29 (from CNY0.91/1.02), to reflect the solid 1H25 results and likely growing contribution from liquid cooling. The new TP of CNY37 is based on 29x 2026F P/E (our P/E unchanged), at - 0.4x SD of the seven- year average P/E, as we believe its liquid cooling could support long- term refrigeration sales growth. The stock currently trades at 25x 2026F P/E.

Advanced Manufacturing

Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls is principally engaged in the research and production of control components and sub- systems for heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVAC&R), home appliances, as well as automotive industry,

We value Sanhua Intelligent with P/E methodology. Our TP of NY37.00 based on 29x 2026F EPS of CNY1.29, at - 0.4x SD of its 7- years historical average P/E, as we believe its liquid cooling could support long- term refrigeration sales growth. The benchmark index is CSI300.
Downside risks: 1) weaker demand in refrigeration business (excl. liquid cooling part), 2) softening margins due to OEMs' price cuts, 3) weak shipment of key automobile clients.

Sanhua Intelligent is environmentally friendly by offering high- end HVAC components to meet higher energy efficiency standard, as well as thermal management systems to new energy vehicles to help reduce CO2 emission.

Risks that may impede the achievement of the target price Downside risks: 1) weaker demand in refrigeration business (excl. liquid cooling part), 2) softening margins due to OEMs' price cuts, 3) weak shipment of key automobile clients.

A rating of 'Buy', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to outperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Neutral', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to perform in line with the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Reduce', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to underperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Suspended', indicates that the rating, target price and estimates have been suspended temporarily to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies. A 'Neutral' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to perform in line with the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Bearish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to underperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. Benchmarks are as follows: United States: S&P 500; Europe: Dow Jones STOXX 600; Global Emerging Markets (ex- Asia): MSCI Emerging Markets ex- Asia. The achievement of any target price may be impeded by general market and macroeconomic trends, and by other risks related to the company or the market, and may not occur if the company's earnings differ from estimates.
